text: Hamilcoa is a plant genus in the family Euphorbiaceae first described as a genus in 1912.Prain, David. 1912. Bulletin of Miscellaneous Information Kew 1912: 107 descriptions in Latin, commentary and range information in EnglishTropicos, Hamilcoa Prain It contains only one known species, Hamilcoa zenkeri, native to Nigeria and Cameroon.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesGovaerts, R., Frodin, D.G. & Radcliffe-Smith, A. (2000). World Checklist and Bibliography of Euphorbiaceae (and Pandaceae) 1-4: 1-1622. The Board of Trustees of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew.Cheek, M. 2004. Hamilcoa zenkeri. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 21 August 2007. ==References== Category:Monotypic Euphorbiaceae genera Category:Flora of Nigeria Category:Flora of Cameroon Category:Stomatocalyceae Category:Vulnerable plants
title: Hamilcoa
